com.brickgame.block

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brickgame.block.Block
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlinkingBlock, HiddenBlock

    public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
    Establishes the structure, appearance, and behavior of unit cells.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block(int i,
             int j)
        A constructor with raw coordinates.
        Parameters:
        i - Horizontal position. Must be from 0 (inclusive) to 10 (exclusive) to show on the screen.
        j - Vertical position. Must be from 0 (inclusive) to 20 (exclusive) to show on the screen.

      • Block

        public Block(int[] coords)
        A constructor with an array of coordinates.
        Parameters:
        coords - A 2D-array with the coordinates. Must range from [0, 0] (inclusive) to [9, 19] (inclusive) to show on the screen.

      • Block

        public Block(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)
        A constructor with an ArrayList of coordinates.
        Parameters:
        list - An ArrayList of size 2 with the coordinates. Must range from [0, 0] (inclusive) to [9, 19] (inclusive) to show on the screen.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int i,
                        int j)
        Positions the Block in the speficied position in the 20x10 grid.
        Parameters:
        i - Horizontal position. Must be from 0 (inclusive) to 10 (exclusive) to show on the screen.
        j - Vertical position. Must be from 0 (inclusive) to 20 (exclusive) to show on the screen.

      • getDirection

        public Constants.Direction getDirection()
        Returns:
        Current direction.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Constants.Direction direction)
        Where to move the Block within the 20x10 grid.
        Parameters:
        direction - One of Direction.UP, Direction.DOWN, Direction.LEFT, Direction.RIGHT.

      • move

        public void move()
        Changes the Sprite to the one at a new position according to direction.
